title.native: シャーマニックプリンセス

description:
To retrieve the talisman stolen by her beloved, Tiara hunts the night, battling monsters with her awesome shamanic powers. Disguised as an ordinary schoolgirl by day, she arrives at his lair only to find her archrival on the scene... protecting the thief. Dark secrets unravel as Tiara faces these powerful opponents, and her one hope for survival may be to betray her mission.

(Source: Media Blasters)

tags.name: Magic
tags.description: Prominently features magical elements or the use of magic.

tags.name: Henshin
tags.description: Prominently features character or costume transformations which often grant special abilities.

tags.name: Primarily Teen Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of teen characters.

tags.name: Urban Fantasy
tags.description: Set in a world similar to the real world, but with the existence of magic or other supernatural elements.

tags.name: Achronological Order
tags.description: Chapters or episodes do not occur in chronological order.

tags.name: Primarily Female Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of female characters.

tags.name: Primarily Adult Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of characters above a high school age.

tags.name: Dissociative Identities
tags.description: A case where one or more people share the same body.

tags.name: Cosmic Horror
tags.description: A type of horror that emphasizes human insignificance in the grand scope of cosmic reality; fearing the unknown and being powerless to fight it.

tags.name: Shapeshifting
tags.description: Features character(s) who changes one's appearance or form.

tags.name: Body Horror
tags.description: Features characters who undergo horrific transformations or disfigurement, often to their own detriment.

tags.name: Denpa
tags.description: Works that feature themes of social dissociation, delusions, and other issues like suicide, bullying, self-isolation, paranoia, and technological necessity in daily lives. Classic iconography: telephone poles, rooftops, and trains.

tags.name: Philosophy
tags.description: Relating or devoted to the study of the fundamental nature of knowledge, reality, and existence.

tags.name: College
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a college or university.

tags.name: School
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a primary or secondary educational institution.

tags.name: Nudity
tags.description: Features a character wearing no clothing or exposing intimate body parts.

tags.name: Gore
tags.description: Prominently features graphic bloodshed and violence.

title.native: 魔法使いTai! vs シャーマニックプリンセス

node.description:
Kawashiro Kazumi is the president & CEO of Bandai Visual. He graduated from Sophia University - a private university in Japan famous for its international climate. In April of 1982, a month after graduation, he started working at Canyon Records. In July of 1989 he joined Bandai and in April of 1994 he was transferred to Bandai Visual of which he became the president of in May of 2003. In 2010, he was succeeded by Ooshita Satoshi, although Kawashiro remained in the company as the vice-president. In April 2012, he was again appointed the president of Bandai Visual.

(Source: AniDB)
Yutaka Takahashi is the CEO of Japan's largest anime shop chain Animate. He also works as executive producer and animation planner.

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/西村博之_(イラストレーター%29)

Originating from [Ajia-do](https://anilist.co/studio/30/).

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/西村博之_(イラストレーター%29)

Originating from [Ajia-do](https://anilist.co/studio/30/).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/207018628)

When being in first grade of high school she saw by chance the cover of an issue of anime magazine Animage, which was drawn by Yasuhiko Yoshikazu. Impressed by that she made it her aim to work for the animation industry. She joined Kaname Productions in January 1983. There she was being influenced by [Yoshinori Kanada](https://anilist.co/staff/106398/) and Mutsumi Inomata. In 1988 uppon Kaname Pro going out of business she became freelancer. Ishida has also dome illustration work for several adult games under the name of Mariko Ijuuin.

She co-founded Studio G-1 Neo together with her ex-husband [Masami Obari](https://anilist.co/staff/100660/).

After 2000 she changed her line of work to mostly writing manga.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/Sunma47) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/三間雅文)

One of the industry's most prolific sound directors, having worked on more than 300 productions.

After having graduated college, Mima joined Magic Capsule, a sound production company ran by his relative [Susumu Aketagawa](https://anilist.co/staff/120062/). In 1986, he debuted as a sound director on [MD Geist](https://anilist.co/anime/1285/MD-Geist/). He left Magic Capsule in 1996, and later joined Techno Sound. In 2004, he became the studio's representative director.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/207018628)

When being in first grade of high school she saw by chance the cover of an issue of anime magazine Animage, which was drawn by Yasuhiko Yoshikazu. Impressed by that she made it her aim to work for the animation industry. She joined Kaname Productions in January 1983. There she was being influenced by [Yoshinori Kanada](https://anilist.co/staff/106398/) and Mutsumi Inomata. In 1988 uppon Kaname Pro going out of business she became freelancer. Ishida has also dome illustration work for several adult games under the name of Mariko Ijuuin.

She co-founded Studio G-1 Neo together with her ex-husband [Masami Obari](https://anilist.co/staff/100660/).

After 2000 she changed her line of work to mostly writing manga.

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/西村博之_(イラストレーター%29)

Originating from [Ajia-do](https://anilist.co/studio/30/).
